title: How to ease wrong exceptions in a class kerning
content:
Hi there,

I have to improve the kerning in a font. The question is there are many wrong exceptions in the class based kerning.  
I need to erase all kerning values that are not equal to the leading pairs. Is there a way to do that?

Thanks in advance.

Ramiro.
author: RamiroE

comments.content:
Ramiro

How many is 'many'?

If you have a couple of hundred bad exceptions it is possible to just delete these from the metrics window kern listing. Make sure you have the kerning classes you require correctly added to the Classes Pallet. The kern values for your exceptions should now turn red in the kern listing.

Now click the top of the kern listing on the header that says 'Value'. This will sort the listing and force all the red exceptions to the end of the listing. Go to the end of the listing and start deleting them.

It is a bit infuriating that you can only select one entry at a time to delete which means if you have more than just a couple of hundred - it will take a long time to delete them all.

Hope this helps  
Malcolm

Hi Malcom,

I was looking for some method less manual. Yeap, I finally did that, but it is a pain not to have a way to reset class members if someone has been messing around with them.  
If you set them to zero they continue ignoring changes in the leading pair. After setting all of them to zero I cleaned the kerning erasing all pairs with a value under one. In that way they work again with the class.
